title: North Region, Brazil
summary: The North Region of Brazil (Portuguese: Região Norte do Brasil; [ʁeʒiˈɐ̃w̃ ˈnɔʁtʃi du bɾaˈziw]) is the largest Region of Brazil, corresponding to 45.27% of the national territory. It is the least inhabited of the country, and contributes with a minor percentage in the national GDP and population. It comprises the states of Acre, Amapá, Amazonas, Pará, Rondônia, Roraima and Tocantins.
